meanings.definition: A person or thing that eclipses or surpasses others in importance or fame.
meanings.sent1: In the world of music, the singer was an eclipser, shining brighter than all others.
meanings.sent2: The movie star became an eclipser, outshining all her co-stars with her talent.
meanings.sent3: The eclipser of the school talent show was a surprise guest appearance by a famous actor.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was an eclipser, casting a shadow over the selfishness of others.
meanings.sent5: The new invention was an eclipser, stealing the spotlight from all previous gadgets.

meanings.definition: To obscure or block the light of something by coming between it and a source of light.
meanings.sent1: The tall building eclipsered the sun, casting a shadow over the park.
meanings.sent2: The tree eclipsered the streetlight, making the road dark and difficult to see.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella eclipsered the view, causing frustration for the spectators.
meanings.sent4: The mountain eclipsered the sunrise, delaying the start of the day.
meanings.sent5: The cloud eclipsered the moon, hiding its glow from the night sky.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outshine someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her intelligence eclipsered her classmates, making her the top student in the school.
meanings.sent2: The new model of the car eclipsered the previous version, attracting more buyers.
meanings.sent3: The bright smile eclipsered the gloomy mood in the room, bringing joy to everyone.
meanings.sent4: His performance eclipsered all others, earning him the lead role in the play.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the painting eclipsered the dullness of the room, adding life to the space.
